verses.verse: Come down,<WH3381> and sit<WH3427> in<WH5921> the dust,<WH6083> O virgin<WH1330> daughter<WH1323> of Babylon,<WH894> sit<WH3427> on the ground:<WH776> there is no<WH369> throne,<WH3678> O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans:<WH3778> for<WH3588> thou shalt no<WH3808> more<WH3254> be called<WH7121> tender<WH7390> and delicate.<WH6028>

Take <WH3947> the millstones,<WH7347> and grind<WH2912> meal:<WH7058> uncover<WH1540> thy locks,<WH6777> make bare<WH2834> the leg,<WH7640> uncover<WH1540> the thigh,<WH7785> pass over<WH5674> the rivers.<WH5104>

Thy nakedness<WH6172> shall be uncovered,<WH1540> yea,<WH1571> thy shame<WH2781> shall be seen:<WH7200> I will take<WH3947> vengeance,<WH5359> and I will not<WH3808> meet<WH6293> thee as a man.<WH120>
As for our redeemer,<WH1350> the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> is his name,<WH8034> the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel.<WH3478>

Sit <WH3427> thou silent,<WH1748> and get<WH935> thee into darkness,<WH2822> O daughter<WH1323> of the Chaldeans:<WH3778> for<WH3588> thou shalt no<WH3808> more<WH3254> be called,<WH7121> The lady<WH1404> of kingdoms.<WH4467>

I was wroth<WH7107> with<WH5921> my people,<WH5971> I have polluted<WH2490> mine inheritance,<WH5159> and given<WH5414> them into thine hand:<WH3027> thou didst show<WH7760> them no<WH3808> mercy;<WH7356> upon<WH5921> the ancient<WH2205> hast thou very<WH3966> heavily laid<WH3513> thy yoke.<WH5923>

And thou saidst,<WH559> I shall be<WH1961> a lady<WH1404> forever:<WH5769> so that<WH5704> thou didst not<WH3808> lay<WH7760> these<WH428> things to<WH5921> thy heart,<WH3820> neither<WH3808> didst remember<WH2142> the latter end<WH319> of it.

Therefore hear<WH8085> now<WH6258> this,<WH2063> thou that art given to pleasures,<WH5719> that dwellest<WH3427> carelessly,<WH983> that sayest<WH559> in thine heart,<WH3824> I<WH589> am, and none else beside<WH657> <WH5750> me; I shall not<WH3808> sit<WH3427> as a widow,<WH490> neither<WH3808> shall I know<WH3045> the loss of children: <WH7908>

But these<WH428> two<WH8147> things shall come<WH935> to thee in a moment<WH7281> in one<WH259> day,<WH3117> the loss of children,<WH7908> and widowhood:<WH489> they shall come<WH935> upon<WH5921> thee in their perfection<WH8537> for the multitude<WH7230> of thy sorceries,<WH3785> and for the great<WH3966> abundance<WH6109> of thine enchantments.<WH2267>

For thou hast trusted<WH982> in thy wickedness:<WH7451> thou hast said,<WH559> None<WH369> seeth<WH7200> me. Thy wisdom<WH2451> and thy knowledge,<WH1847> it<WH1931> hath perverted<WH7725> thee; and thou hast said<WH559> in thine heart,<WH3820> I<WH589> am, and none else beside<WH657> <WH5750> me.

Therefore shall evil<WH7451> come<WH935> upon<WH5921> thee; thou shalt not<WH3808> know<WH3045> from whence it riseth:<WH7837> and mischief<WH1943> shall fall<WH5307> upon<WH5921> thee; thou shalt not<WH3808> be able<WH3201> to put it off:<WH3722> and desolation<WH7722> shall come<WH935> upon<WH5921> thee suddenly,<WH6597> which thou shalt not<WH3808> know.<WH3045>

Stand <WH5975> now<WH4994> with thine enchantments,<WH2267> and with the multitude<WH7230> of thy sorceries,<WH3785> wherein<WH834> thou hast labored<WH3021> from thy youth;<WH4480> <WH5271> if so be<WH194> thou shalt be able<WH3201> to profit,<WH3276> if so be<WH194> thou mayest prevail.<WH6206>

Thou art wearied<WH3811> in the multitude<WH7230> of thy counsels.<WH6098> Let now<WH4994> the astrologers,<WH1895> <WH8064> the stargazers,<WH2372> <WH3556> the monthly<WH2320> prognosticators,<WH3045> stand up,<WH5975> and save<WH3467> thee from these things that<WH4480> <WH834> shall come<WH935> upon<WH5921> thee.

Behold, <WH2009> they shall be<WH1961> as stubble;<WH7179> the fire<WH784> shall burn<WH8313> them; they shall not<WH3808> deliver<WH5337> <WH853> themselves<WH5315> from the power<WH4480> <WH3027> of the flame:<WH3852> there shall not<WH369> be a coal<WH1513> to warm<WH2552> at, nor fire<WH217> to sit<WH3427> before<WH5048> it.

Thus <WH3651> shall they be<WH1961> unto thee with whom<WH834> thou hast labored,<WH3021> even thy merchants,<WH5503> from thy youth:<WH4480> <WH5271> they shall wander<WH8582> every one<WH376> to his quarter;<WH5676> none<WH369> shall save<WH3467> thee.
